findings.label: Suppliers with Current Red Flags
findings.detail: 5 current suppliers have Companies House compliance issues (historical payments were made before breaches started)

findings.label: Likely Duplicate Payments
findings.detail: 181 high-confidence duplicate groups with same supplier, amount, date and reference (3+ copies) (after filtering 1247 CSV republication artifacts)
findings.context_note: Quarterly CSV overlaps (same transaction appearing in 2 files) have been filtered out. Remaining duplicates show 3+ identical copies, which are more likely genuine overpayments.

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 5 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week
findings.context_note: Split payment detection has a high false-positive rate. Batch processing, staged invoices, and legitimate recurring payments can all trigger this pattern. FOI request for procurement approval chain recommended before drawing conclusions.

findings.label: Round-Number Payments (>£5K)
findings.detail: 2575 exact round-number payments over £5,000 — may indicate estimates rather than invoiced amounts

findings.label: Year-End Spending Pattern
findings.detail: Housing Revenue Account spent 12.7x their monthly average in March (£13.5M above normal). Note: UK councils operate on April–March fiscal years, so elevated March spending is common as departments finalise annual budgets. Spikes above 3x warrant further scrutiny.
findings.context_note: March spending above the monthly average is expected for UK councils on April–March fiscal years. Compare against prior years' March figures for meaningful analysis.

findings.label: Rapid Payment Suppliers
findings.detail: 15 suppliers receive payments every <14 days on average. Top: Lcs Vehicle Ltd (2.0 day avg, 15 payments, £12.5K)

findings.label: Benford's Law Anomaly
findings.detail: Significant deviation from Benford's Law (p < 0.001). Digit 5 deviates 8.2% from expected distribution across 43,063 transactions. Note: with 43,063 transactions, chi-squared tests are highly sensitive — the 8.2% max digit deviation is the more practical measure of anomaly.
findings.context_note: Chi-squared values on samples of 43,063+ transactions are naturally inflated and will almost always show statistical significance. The max digit deviation (8.2%) is a more meaningful indicator — deviations under 5% are typical for legitimate council spending.

findings.label: Second-Digit Benford's Anomaly
findings.detail: Second-digit distribution across 43,063 transactions shows p < 0.001 (highly significant). Digit 0 deviates 7.85% from Nigrini's expected distribution. Second-digit tests are more discriminating than first-digit for detecting round-number bias and fabricated invoices.
findings.context_note: Benford's second-digit analysis (Nigrini, 2012) uses chi-squared with 9 df. Critical values: 16.92 (p=0.05), 21.67 (p=0.01), 27.88 (p=0.001). n=43,063.

findings.label: Weak Competition Indicators
findings.detail: 16 contracts show signs of limited competition (short tender periods or rapid award). Top: Framework for Specialist Trade Works (£1.5M)
findings.context_note: Contracts Finder does not publish bid counts. These flags use proxy signals: tender periods under 14 days and awards within 7 days of deadline. Short timelines may have legitimate explanations (framework call-offs, urgency).

key_findings.title: 1 suppliers with clock-like payment regularity
key_findings.description: These suppliers receive payments at near-identical intervals (std dev <5 days). Top: Unknown — every 2.7 days (1075 payments, £4.2M)

key_findings.title: MATRIX SCM LTD: 5648 transactions totalling £4.2M
key_findings.description: Averaging £738 per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier

key_findings.title: 14 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £19.1M total
key_findings.description: Compare what each council pays the same suppliers for similar services

key_findings.title: WORLD PAY: 8440% price gap between councils
key_findings.description: West_Lancashire pays £1.7K avg vs Blackburn £20 (both with 3+ transactions). Price differences may reflect different service scope, contract terms, or volumes rather than overcharging — manual review recommended.
key_findings.context_note: Cross-council price comparisons use common financial years only (where both councils have data for the same supplier). This prevents unfair comparisons between councils with different data periods. Differences may still reflect different service levels or contract terms.

5 suppliers with current CH red flags

fraud_triangle.methodology: Fraud triangle (Cressey 1953): screening tool synthesising existing DOGE analysis signals. Not an accusation of fraud.

budget_variance.caveat: AI DOGE tracks spending >£500 only (10 financial years annualised). GOV.UK outturn is all expenditure for 2024-25. Coverage ratios reflect threshold differences, not missing data.
